title: Drawing, "Project for Tables; Sketches for Chests of Drawers and Possibly Frieze Stand", ca. 1820
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over traces of graphite on cream laid paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: At left, table with square top, supported by baluster. Flower and vase set on table. At right, oblong table supported by four fluted columns. At upper edge, right part of chest of drawers, upper part standing on legs. Verso: shown vertically, three chimerae supporting top, which seems to be bordered by railing. In middle rises pavilion with trellis.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Project for Tables; Sketches for Chests of Drawers and Possibly Frieze Stand", ca. 1820.
ca. 1820. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over traces of graphite on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-3030.
